docs.text: gov.nist.trec.tipster TIPSTER is sometimes also called the Text Research Collection Volume or TREC. The TIPSTER project was sponsored by the Software and Intelligent Systems Technology Office of the Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA/SISTO) in an effort to significantly advance the state of the art in effective document detection (information retrieval) and data extraction from large, real-world data collections. The detection data is comprised of a test collection built at NIST for the TIPSTER project and the related TREC project. The TREC project has many other participating information retrieval research groups, working on the same task as the TIPSTER groups, but meeting once a year in a workshop to compare results (similar to MUC). The test collection consists of three CD-ROMs of SGML encoded documents distributed by LDC plus queries and answers (relevant documents) distributed by NIST. See also https://trec.nist.gov/data/docs_eng.html and https://trec.nist.gov/data/intro_eng.html List of datasets gov.nist.trec.tipster.ap88 Associated Press document collection (1988) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC93T3A gov.nist.trec.tipster.ap89 Associated Press document collection (1989) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC93T3A gov.nist.trec.tipster.ap90 Associated Press docs.text: TIPSTER is sometimes also called the Text Research Collection Volume or TREC. The TIPSTER project was sponsored by the Software and Intelligent Systems Technology Office of the Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA/SISTO) in an effort to significantly advance the state of the art in effective document detection (information retrieval) and data extraction from large, real-world data collections. The detection data is comprised of a test collection built at NIST for the TIPSTER project and the related TREC project. The TREC project has many other participating information retrieval research groups, working on the same task as the TIPSTER groups, but meeting once a year in a workshop to compare results (similar to MUC). The test collection consists of three CD-ROMs of SGML encoded documents distributed by LDC plus queries and answers (relevant documents) distributed by NIST. See also https://trec.nist.gov/data/docs_eng.html and https://trec.nist.gov/data/intro_eng.html

docs.text: org.universaldependencies.french List of datasets org.universaldependencies.french.gsd French GSD https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_French-GSD The UD_French-GSD was converted in 2015 from the content head version of the universal dependency treebank v2.0 (https://github.com/ryanmcd/uni-dep-tb). It is updated since 2015 independently from the previous source.
docs.title: org.universaldependencies.french

It is updated since 2015 independently from the previous source.

docs.text: edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint The AQUAINT Corpus, Linguistic Data Consortium (LDC) catalog number LDC2002T31 and ISBN 1-58563-240-6 consists of newswire text data in English, drawn from three sources: the Xinhua News Service (People's Republic of China), the New York Times News Service, and the Associated Press Worldstream News Service. It was prepared by the LDC for the AQUAINT Project, and will be used in official benchmark evaluations conducted by National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). List of datasets edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint.apw Associated Press (1998-2000) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2002T31 edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint.nyt New York Times (1998-2000) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2002T31 edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint.xie Xinhua News Agency newswires (1996-2000) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2002T31 edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint Aquaint dataset https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2002T31
docs.title: edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint

docs.text: The AQUAINT Corpus, Linguistic Data Consortium (LDC) catalog number LDC2002T31 and ISBN 1-58563-240-6 consists of newswire text data in English, drawn from three sources: the Xinhua News Service (People's Republic of China), the New York Times News Service, and the Associated Press Worldstream News Service. It was prepared by the LDC for the AQUAINT Project, and will be used in official benchmark evaluations conducted by National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

docs.text: edu.stanford.glove GloVe is an unsupervised learning algorithm for obtaining vector representations for words. Training is performed on aggregated global word-word co-occurrence statistics from a corpus, and the resulting representations showcase interesting linear substructures of the word vector space. List of datasets edu.stanford.glove.6b Embeddings for 6B words in various dimensions word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.6b.50 Glove 6B - dimension 50 word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.6b.100 Glove 6B - dimension 100 word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.6b.200 Glove 6B - dimension 200 word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.6b.300 Glove 6B - dimension 200 word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.42b Glove embeddings trained on Common Crawl with 42B tokens word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.840b Glove embeddings trained on Common Crawl with 840B tokens word embeddings
docs.title: edu.stanford.glove
